001package io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.util;
002
003import io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.util.ResourceLoader;
004import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.components.interceptor.ApiResponse;
005import java.util.List;
006import java.util.Objects;
007
008import static io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.util.ObjectFormatter.escapeHtml;
009
010/**
011 * Utility class for converting API responses into an HTML representation.
012 *
013 * <p>Provides methods to summarize a list of {@link ApiResponse} objects‚Äîcounting total,
014 * successful, warning, and error responses‚Äîand to build detailed accordion-style
015 * HTML blocks for each response, with proper HTML escaping.
016 *
017 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
018 */
019public final class ResponseFormatter {
020
021   public static final String DIV_CLOSE = "</div>";
022
023   private ResponseFormatter() {
024   }
025
026   /**
027    * Formats a list of responses into an HTML string, summarizing request counts and formatting individual responses.
028    *
029    * @param responses a list of response objects, which may include lists of responses
030    * @return a string containing the generated HTML with formatted responses
031    */
032   public static String formatResponses(List<ApiResponse> responses) {
033
034      List<ApiResponse> formattedResponses = responses.stream()
035            .map(response -> {
036               try {
037                  ApiResponse copy = new ApiResponse(response.getUrl(), response.getMethod(), response.getStatus());
038                  String body = response.getBody();
039                  if (body != null && body.length() > 10000) {
040                     copy.setBody(body.substring(0, 1000) + "...");
041                  } else {
042                     copy.setBody(body);
043                  }
044                  return copy;
045               } catch (Exception e) {
046                  return null;
047               }
048            })
049            .filter(Objects::nonNull)
050            .toList();
051
052      int totalRequests = 0;
053      int successCount = 0;
054      int warningCount = 0;
055      int errorCount = 0;
056
057      for (ApiResponse response : formattedResponses) {
058         totalRequests++;
059         int status = response.getStatus();
060         if (status >= 400) {
061            errorCount++;
062         } else if (status >= 300) {
063            warningCount++;
064         } else if (status > 0) {
065            successCount++;
066         }
067      }
068
069      String templateHtml = ResourceLoader.loadResourceFile("allure/html/intercepted-responses.html");
070      StringBuilder htmlBuilder = new StringBuilder(
071            templateHtml.replace("{{total}}", String.valueOf(totalRequests))
072                  .replace("{{success}}", String.valueOf(successCount))
073                  .replace("{{warning}}", String.valueOf(warningCount))
074                  .replace("{{error}}", String.valueOf(errorCount)));
075
076      for (int i = 0; i < formattedResponses.size(); i++) {
077         appendResponseAccordion(htmlBuilder, formattedResponses.get(i), i);
078      }
079
080      return htmlBuilder.toString();
081   }
082
083
084   /**
085    * Appends an accordion HTML block for a given response to the provided StringBuilder.
086    *
087    * @param html     the StringBuilder to append the HTML content to
088    * @param response the response object to format
089    * @param index    the index used to uniquely identify the accordion elements
090    */
091   private static void appendResponseAccordion(StringBuilder html, ApiResponse response, int index) {
092      try {
093
094         String url = response.getUrl();
095         String method = response.getMethod();
096         int status = response.getStatus();
097         String body = response.getBody();
098
099         String statusClass = "status-success";
100         if (status >= 400) {
101            statusClass = "status-error";
102         } else if (status >= 300) {
103            statusClass = "status-warning";
104         }
105
106         String endpoint = extractEndpoint(url);
107
108         html.append("<div class='accordion'>")
109               .append("<div class='accordion-header' id='header-").append(index)
110               .append("' onclick='toggleAccordion(").append(index).append(")'>")
111               .append("<div class='method'>").append(method).append(DIV_CLOSE)
112               .append("<div class='url'>").append(endpoint).append(DIV_CLOSE)
113               .append("<div class='status ").append(statusClass).append("'>")
114               .append(status).append(DIV_CLOSE)
115               .append("<span class='chevron'>&#9660;</span>")
116               .append(DIV_CLOSE)
117               .append("<div id='content-").append(index).append("' class='accordion-content'>")
118               .append("<pre>").append(escapeHtml(body != null ? body : "")).append("</pre>")
119               .append(DIV_CLOSE)
120               .append(DIV_CLOSE);
121      } catch (Exception ignore) {
122         //ignore exception
123      }
124   }
125
126
127   /**
128    * Extracts the endpoint path from a URL string.
129    *
130    * @param url the full URL string
131    * @return the endpoint path if available, or the original URL if extraction fails
132    */
133   private static String extractEndpoint(String url) {
134      try {
135         java.net.URL urlObj = new java.net.URL(url);
136         String endpoint = urlObj.getPath();
137         return endpoint.isEmpty() ? "/" : endpoint;
138      } catch (Exception e) {
139         return url;
140      }
141   }
142
143}
